items.title: Work
excuses: My WiFi saw the meeting invite and quit out of protest.
My cat scheduled a Zoom call of its own and hijacked my laptop.
The printer demanded a blood sacrifice before it would work.
I was locked in an epic battle with a spreadsheet formula.
My keyboard went on strike and only typed emojis.
I thought today was Saturday until my boss called.
My calendar double-booked me with a nap.
I spilled coffee on my work badge and it stopped scanning.
My headset tangled itself into a Gordian knot.
The office plants staged a revolt and I had to negotiate peace.

items.title: Social
excuses: I was abducted by a particularly clingy couch.
I fell asleep trying to pick an outfit.
My fridge begged me to keep it company.
I got lost scrolling memes and never found my way back.
My dog threw a party and I had to supervise.
I was cursed by Netflix’s ‘Next Episode’ button.
I accidentally RSVP’d yes to my own imaginary event.
I was too busy pretending to be busy.
My horoscope said ‘stay home or else’.
I got stuck in traffic… in my kitchen.

items.title: Family
excuses: My toddler changed the WiFi password and forgot it.
We were reenacting a soap opera at dinner.
Grandma challenged me to Mario Kart and refused to lose.
Our dog ate the car keys, again.
I had to mediate a debate about pineapple on pizza.
Family karaoke night turned into a hostage situation.
We lost the TV remote and it became a family emergency.
Someone hid the snacks and we launched a full investigation.
Uncle Bob started telling a story that lasted three hours.
Our board game turned into a war crime tribunal.

items.title: School
excuses: My homework was eaten by AI instead of the dog.
I accidentally submitted my grocery list instead of my essay.
The WiFi only worked for TikTok, not assignments.
I had to finish a side quest before doing homework.
My alarm clock hit snooze on me.
I couldn’t attend class, I was binge-studying memes.
The teacher’s email went to my spam folder labeled ‘bad vibes’.
I mistook my math homework for abstract art.
My pencil unionized and refused to write.
I was late because my backpack staged a sit-in.

items.title: Creative
excuses: I was trapped brainstorming the perfect excuse.
Aliens gave me homework of their own.
My muse ghosted me at the last second.
The canvas rejected my artistic vision.
I was too busy drawing a self-portrait as a potato.
My creative energy was stolen by a raccoon.
I had to duel with Photoshop until dawn.
My pen ink ran away with the highlighter.
I wrote my idea on a napkin and then ate it accidentally.
The voices in my head couldn’t agree on a concept.

items.title: Funny
excuses: I was kidnapped by my blanket and Stockholm syndrome set in.
My goldfish needed relationship advice.
I joined a staring contest with my ceiling fan and lost.
My imaginary friend locked me out of the house.
I was too busy practicing my Oscar speech in the shower.
I fell into a Wikipedia rabbit hole about penguins.
I was rehearsing my stand-up set for the toaster.
I had to rescue my phone from falling into the couch abyss.
I joined a cult of squirrels but they let me go at sundown.
I spent three hours arguing with autocorrect.
